block.p: The five most e-mailed articles from nytimes.com/sports for June 2 to 8.
1. A GREAT HORSE, BUT WHO TAKES THE WINNINGS? -- Curlin's tangled ownership may be decided in court. (Published June 4)
2. YANKS BRIGHTENED A LIFE BY SHOWING THEY CARED -- Remembering Ray Smith, a special fan who died at the age of 23. (June 3)
3. READY FOR N.B.A. THRONE, BUT NOT LIKE MIKE -- The multidimensional LeBron James comes of age and takes Cleveland to the finals. (June 6)
4. RODRIGUEZ KEEPS STRADDLING BASEBALL'S FOUL LINE -- The Yankees' Alex Rodriguez shouts while running the bases and spurs debate about what is acceptable and what is not. (June 1)
5. THE BOY WONDERS OF LACROSSE -- Rhamel and Shamel Bratton of Huntington, N.Y., are headed to Virginia. (June 3)
